results.title: Renewable energy in Australia
results.creator_credit: Philip Robertson, Michael Rubetzki and Film Australia
results.brief_description: The film presents a range of alternatives to conventional energy sources for small-scale power requirements. Surveys the systems and technology currently available in Australia including wind, mini-hydro, biomass and photovoltaic systems.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Robertson, Michael Rubetzki and Film Australia

results.title: The Squat
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place of Your Own”.
The tape looks at the predicament of the growing number of young people who are homeless. Three people live in a refuge for a time and then decide to occupy, and renovate an abandoned house nearby

results.title: Nauru
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australia. Dept. of Territories and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Presents life on Nauru, showing the people fishing, taming birds to attract wild ones, playing a ball game and wrestling. Phosphate, the only economic resource is shown being mined, crushed, dried and exported. As it runs out in thirty years, the Australian government which administers the island is planning for the future of the islanders - as well as exercising justice, educating children, and providing Australian scholarship. Includes the co-operative store, and the Local Government Council which Nauruans run.

results.title: The Happy Island
results.creator_credit: Ann Gurr, Maslyn Williams, Shan Benson, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Gemo Island Hospital, Papua, seen through the eyes of one of the nurses. As well as general wards separate blocks for T.B. and leprosy cases are maintained and within them, three schools are run.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ann Gurr, Maslyn Williams, Shan Benson, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian National Film Board

results.title: The Big island
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The aim of this film is to show an international audience within a limited time span some attractive aspects of Australian life. Representing Australia as a brisk and exciting place and creating a mood of a young country on the move. Cinematography by Keith Gow, and Don McAlpine. Music by George Dreyfus. (Awards: AFI Travel Award 1970)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: One good reason
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, Roland Beckett and Film Australia
results.brief_description: An examination of the reactions of a career army man who is considering resigning to take advantage of an attractive offer to join a commercial organisation. Stars Bill Hunter as Major Archer.

results.title: Citizen soldier
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description: An impression of the life throughout the year of a citizen soldier in the Citizens Military Forces. It delves into such aspects as how effective CMF training really is, why it is important to the individual and the country and what it offers to the soldier and to his employer.

results.title: Search and rescue
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and RGA Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Explains the ways in which search and rescue can be facilitated should the crew in distress observe certain basic procedures. Cast includes Tony Barry, patrick Bollen, Bob Mercer.

results.title: Scouting in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Joe Scully, Australian Boy Scouts Association and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Illustrates the impact upon a boy of his joining the Scouts, the involvement of his father in the Movement, the Scouts’ work in the community and the international status of the Scouting Movement. Includes scenes of a Scout Rally, an investiture, a Group Committee and the ‘Jamboree of the New Endeavour’ at Leppington, N.S.W
